definition: to court disaster (idiom)/to dig one's own grave
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased

sentences.english: This poor woman will go to her grave without ever achieving her goal.
sentences.chinese: 這個可憐的女人實現不了她的目標，她會自取滅亡。

sentences.english: Experience has taught us that to adopt an ostrich-like policy here is suicidal.
sentences.chinese: 經驗告訴我們對現實採取迴避態度是自取滅亡。

sentences.english: Self barricading is to court one's own ruin.
sentences.chinese: 自我阻塞就是自取滅亡。

sentences.english: The church at Corinth was self-destructing because it was filled with division.
sentences.chinese: 哥林多教會因爲充滿分爭而自取滅亡。

sentences.english: Procrastination, however, is the number one killer. Procrastinators self-destruct.
Niall Ferguson: "We've discussed two reasons to non-suicidal."
sentences.chinese: 我們已經討論過兩個不自取滅亡的理由。

definition: to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
(desired) effect/(expected) result/effective
harmful teachings/evil doctrine
to raise (animals)
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
conclusion/judgment/verdict
to form a clique
haughty/proud
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
to decide alone without consultation/arbitrary/dictatorial
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
